page.title: 09Reflections of Mr.Smith
page.content: At old Fritchley school there was only 1 teacher for all the subjects. Children went to school until they were 14. Children had to pay a penny every Monday. Some days my sister couldn't go to school because my mother hadn't got a penny. There was a lot of home industry in the early 19th century. In 1845 there were 270 knitting frames, about 5 years later in 1850 there were 127 left. About 300 people lived in Fritchley in 1927, about 127 families. There are about 611 people living in Fritchley now. A lot of village people worked in the mine kilns at Ambergate, a lot of people walked to Lea Mills at Belper. Some worked on the mineral railroads and stone quarries. {* * * * *
